DOCNAME: GUTIERREZ DORADO AND DORADO ORTIZ v. SPAIN
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and lived in GPE . They were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE , and PERSON , barrister in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the second applicant died . On DATE , the first applicant informed the ORG that he wished to pursue the application both on his behalf and on behalf of his late mother , the second applicant .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , Mr PERSON , who was the grandfather of the first applicant and the father of the second applicant and a Member of the NORP ORG belonging to the socialist party ( “ NORP ” ) , was forcibly taken away by military forces in circumstances that have not yet been fully established . On DATE , he was travelling on a train from GPE to GPE . Armed forces took him away with CARDINAL other persons ( another Member of ORG and the NORP consul in GPE ) . They were transferred to the garrison of “ GPE ” in GPE . The NORP Consul was immediately released . Mr PERSON and the other man were detained until DATE because Mr Dorado PERSON ’s signature appears as a witness on the death certificate of another detainee who apparently died in the garrison ( LOC , a journalist and ex - Socialist Member of ORG ) .
CARDINAL . The applicants have no reliable information as to their relative ’s fate after DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a dead body was discovered which had documents with Mr PERSON name in the pockets . The autopsy stated that he died “ as a result of firearm injuries with serious wounds in the brain and liver ” . The dead body was registered in the obituary book as Mr Dorado PERSON . On CARDINAL DATE , the civil registry judge decided that there was insufficient evidence to conclude that the corpse was that of Mr Dorado PERSON and made an entry in the civil registry of PERSON that the body was that of an “ unknown man ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after the death of PERSON , an ORG PERSON was passed by the newly established ORG which granted immunity from prosecution to everyone who had committed any offence for political reasons prior to DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE , the applicants assisted Mr PERSON wife , PERSON ( their mother and grandmother respectively ) in the proceedings to obtain official confirmation of Mr Dorado PERSON ’s disappearance , a necessary procedural step before PERSON could obtain her widow ’s pension in accordance with the applicable law . NORP authorities dismissed her request for widow ’s pension arguing that she could not be entitled to widow ’s benefits as there was no evidence of her husband ’s death in the civil registry books .

CARDINAL . In DATE , PERSON initiated a procedure for voluntary declaration of death before the courts of GPE . The procedure lasted until DATE . On DATE the first instance court no . CARDINAL of GPE , after confirming that Mr PERSON had disappeared and that his fate and whereabouts were unknown , ordered that his death be recorded in the civil registry books . The judge established DATE as the date of death . PERSON was finally entitled to perceive her widow ’s pension .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the second applicant brought a criminal complaint before FAC no . CARDINAL of PERSON ( investigating Judge ) . She complained about the abduction and possible murder of Mr PERSON in DATE amounting to war crimes for which there were no statute of limitations . On DATE , the investigating Judge ruled against the applicant stating that the facts complained of amounted to a “ hypothetical simple murder ” which was subject to a statute of limitations of DATE under LAW . As to the possibility that war crimes or crimes against humanity could not be time - barred , the Judge said that this could only apply after DATE when the criminal code was amended in that sense and that the new rule could not be retrospectively applied to crimes which had already been time - barred by then .

CARDINAL . The second applicant appealed to FAC of GPE . On DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal and confirmed the decision of the investigating Judge . The appellate court stated that the current constitutional regime prevented the prosecution of crimes committed during the Civil War since such claims would be contrary to the conciliatory nature of the NORP constitutional framework and would only serve at “ reviving old wounds or remove the embers of civil confrontation ” .
CARDINAL . The second applicant filed an amparo appeal against this decision before ORG . On DATE , ORG declared the appeal inadmissible for being devoid of constitutional content .

CARDINAL . The second applicant , on DATE , together with several ORG associations , filed a complaint before the Audiencia Nacional in GPE . They complained that their relatives had suffered systematic enforced disappearances as well as possible systematic killings as part of a deliberate and calculated plan to eliminate a sector of the population . On DATE , the ORG Investigating Judge no . CARDINAL , in a preliminary investigation , ordered several public and private institutions to submit information on individuals disappeared after DATE as a result of the Civil War and the subsequent PERSON regime .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the Investigating Judge issued a ruling accepting jurisdiction , in so far as the crimes had been committed against high - level national institutions and the form of Government ( military rebellion of DATE and the subsequent enforced disappearances ) . The ruling stated that all the facts complained of were not to be considered in isolation but rather within the wider context of the planned , massive repression by the PERSON regime which began on DATE against political opponents , carried out in a systematic manner which could amount to crimes against humanity as provided by LAW ( LAW in force ) . The Investigating Judge further pointed out that the practice of enforced disappearances was used systematically to make it impossible to identify the victims and therefore prevent any judicial action against the perpetrators . He further noted that the whereabouts and fate of CARDINAL of people that had been detained by the authorities were still unknown . These were continuous crimes because no information had been given to the families of the disappeared . The distress and anguish suffered by the relatives of the victims who still did not know the whereabouts and fate of their beloved ones amounted to a violation of LAW ( with reference to GPE v. GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALIV ) .
CARDINAL . The Public Prosecutor appealed against the Investigating Judge ’s decision , requesting the closure of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the plenary of the Audiencia Nacional ( criminal division ) ordered all proceedings related to exhumations of mass graves to be suspended until final decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the Investigating Judge no . CARDINAL issued a decision relinquishing jurisdiction and advising the complainants to pursue their complaints before provincial courts . After receiving evidence that all the officials suspected ( including PERSON ) had died , he declared their criminal responsibility extinguished . Complaints for the same facts alleged against other possible suspects would fall within the jurisdiction of the territorial courts competent in respect of the different mass graves ( among which the territorial courts of GPE ) . In its decision , the ORG reiterated that these crimes should be prosecuted as the continuing crime of enforced disappearance and that there could be no application of the statute of limitations . He pointed out that the lack of official ex officio investigation for DATE coupled with the numerous obstacles introduced by ORG to the opening of an investigation was in conflict with the ORG and the PACE resolution CARDINAL of DATE on enforced disappearances .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the plenary of the Audiencia Nacional ( criminal division ) declared its lack of jurisdiction to investigate these crimes . The Audiencia Nacional noted that the crime of military rebellion had never fallen within its jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . The family of Mr PERSON initiated several parallel initiatives to the judicial procedures to clarify his disappearance . On DATE , the second applicant sent a petition to the competent military tribunal requesting information about the detention and whereabouts of Mr PERSON . On DATE , the military tribunal responded stating that they had no information about him .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG dismissed the ORG petition to permit the exhumation of the body of Mr PERSON from a mass grave identified in a pit of the cemetery in GPE . The local authorities argued that there were CARDINAL tombstones above the mass grave and they had no authorization to remove them from the next of kin of the individuals buried there .

CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to a petition by the applicants , the prison authorities of PERSON issued a certificate confirming that Mr PERSON had been detained there from CARDINAL to DATE . The certificate stated that the reasons for the detention were “ unknown ” and that he was released upon orders from the military commander of PERSON and surrendered to ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the first applicant privately hired the services of forensic experts . In accordance with LAW enacted in DATE ) , the first applicant was granted public funds ( EUR MONEY ) by ORG Presidency to assist in the process of searching and recovering the remains of his grandfather . The forensic experts located a mass grave in the cemetery of “ ORG ” in GPE where allegedly the corpse of Mr PERSON might be buried according to the DATE inscription in the cemetery obituary book . Although ORG Investigative Judge no . CARDINAL had issued a specific order to the courts in GPE stating that the forensic works regarding the exhumation of Mr PERSON were authorized , ORG of Cordoba issued an order to suspend all works . The forensic works have been suspended since then .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG issued a decision denying the granting of further funds for the exhumation of the remains of Mr Dorado PERSON .

CARDINAL . It is submitted by the applicants that provincial courts , including the courts in GPE , are dismissing complaints by individuals disregarding the arguments of the Audiencia Nacional ’s Investigating Judge no . CARDINAL in its decision on relinquishment .
